frame.name: Remembering_information
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Cognizer</fen> retains facts in memory and is able to retrieve them. The <fen>Mental_content</fen> may be presented in clearly propositional form as a finite clause. It may also take the form of an embedded question or be a concealed question in the form of a simple NP.
<ex> I was impressed that <fex name="cog">she</fex> 'd actually <t>remembered</t> <fex name="men">Radish 's name</fex> (= what Radish's name is) </ex>
<ex>Oh, and for those who like to continually whinge about how the French are 'surrender monkeys' - <t>remember</t> <fex name="men">Napoleon</fex> (= who Napoleon was)?</ex>
<ex> <fex name="cog">I</fex> ca n't <t>remember</t> <fex name="men">what DSP stands for</fex>.</ex>
<ex>And <fex name="cog">Bill</fex> can <fex name="tim">still</fex> <t>remember</t> <fex name="men">the pattern</fex> (= what the pattern is). </ex>
<ex><fex name="men">What</fex> do <fex name="cog">you</fex> <t>remember</t> <fex name="top">about your grandma</fex>?</ex>
<ex></ex> Notice that this frame is very general. It can be used to talk about detailed reports of past experience.
<ex>I don't know if I lost consciousness for a while. But I <t>remember</t> <fex name="men">that I was lying in the middle of the road with people trying to assist me</fex>.</ex>
<ex></ex>
Notice that <fen>Mental_content</fen> reported within this frame is presented as factive, i.e. as reliable and accurate. Consider the following contrasts:
<ex>1a. I <t>remember</t> her as selfish--but I might be wrong.</ex> <ex>1b. ??I <t>remember</t> that she was selfish--but I might be wrong.</ex>
<ex>2a. Bill <t>remembers</t> her as smarter than she is.</ex> <ex>2b.*Bill <t>remembers</t> that she is smarter than she is.</ex>
The (b) sentences, which belong in this frame, are less acceptable than the (a)-sentences as they suggest that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> takes their memory to be accurate while suggesting at the same time that the memory might be or is inaccurate. In the (a) sentences, which belong to the Remembering_experience frame, there is no contradiction as the remembering is taken to be subjective and not necessarily accurate. <ex></ex> The concealed question uses with personal names that occur in this frame are not always easy to distinguish from instances of the Remembering_experience frame where a Salient_entity alone is referred to in 3a and 3b, which belong to the Remembering_experience frame, there is no question of identity: remembering here means thinking of one's memories of the relevant person. 3c is different: the hearer is asked whether they know who the person is; it belongs in this frame.
<ex>3a. I <t>remember</t> her fondly</ex> <ex>3b. Please take a moment to <t>remember</t> Caesar and his Family.</ex> <ex>3c. Do you <t>remember</t> <fex name="men">Alexander the Great</fex>? He was one of history's most prolific conquerors, and he did it all in his twenties.</ex>
<ex></ex> This frame differs from Remembering_to_do in that this frame is strictly talking about a fact, whereas the Remembering_to_do frame is strictly about tasks which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> would be expected to do. Remembering_to_do uses normally occur with infinitival complements.</def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person who retains and retrieves information.
<ex>I bet <fex name="cog">Johno</fex> can <t>remember</t> the name of the Ramones' drummer.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Mental_content
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Mental_content</fen> stored by and accessible to the <fen>Cognizer</fen>. It may derive from experience or activity or simply from being informed of it.
<ex>Do you <t>remember</t> <fex name="men">how to spell cupboard ?</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Accuracy
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the remembered <fen>Mental_content</fen> matches the information or experience that it is based on.
<ex>If I <t>remember</t> <fex name="acc">correctly</fex> the pre-War price for hanging a wall up, a roll of wallpaper was about sixpence a roll , and that included preparing as well.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> retrieves <fen>Mental_content</fen> or forgets it.
<ex> <fex name="tim">Afterwards</fex>, I <t>forgot</t> what I was pissed off about, but I was. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity, concrete or abstract, or an event that the remembered <fen>Mental_content</fen> is about.
<ex>The boy who suffered brain damage when he was hit by a vehicle while walking into school testified Friday he <t>remembers</t> nothing <fex name="top">about being hit</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Context
FE.definition:
<def-root>A situation or a text from which the <fen>Mental_content</fen> was acquired.
<ex>You will <t>remember</t> <fex name="con">from grade school</fex> that you do not want to make the nuns impatient.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: remember.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to recall a fact to the mind

lexUnit.name: forget.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: be unable to remember a fact
